ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Definitely would learn a lot but time consuming.
Be prepared for work - there's no curve and if you want a good grade, you better work for it. That's not to say it's not worth doing -it definitely is, and you'll learn a lot.
LOTS OF WORK!! BEWARE!! Much more than 1st semester. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED... A fun class, however.

I would recommend it as either a segue to higher level courses or for people needing the language credit. It's a small, but continuous amount of work, and there are daily vocab quizzes-- at the same time, a lot of the vocab is familiar, which helps some. And by the end of the semester, you really do become a better speaker and writer.

Take this if you really want to learn the language. If you are coming in second semester, you may find the transition a bit rough because you won't be familiar with the expectations of the course, although you will learn quickly. Expect 1-2 hours of homework per night, between the and studying for the next day's
